intro: Simsia amplexicaulis var. genuina, commonly known as the clasping leaf simsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its unique foliage, where the leaves wrap around the stems in a clasping manner, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding visual interest to its foliage. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat challenging plant to grow outside its native range.
